content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the function in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
  return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[ _-]+", "_")
end
```
The `replace` function replaces all instances of a regex pattern with something else. In this case, it is used to replace one or more spaces or hyphens with underscores. The `strip` function removes any leading or trailing whitespaces and the `lowercase` function converts all characters to lower case.
